photo.description: It deserved two pictures. Verona - Italy
photo.tags: vacation verona
photo.title: Piazza dei Signori

photo.description: La torre dei Lamberti è una torre medioevale di Verona di 84 metri, che svetta da piazza Erbe, nel centro storico della città. La sua costruzione iniziò nel 1172. Nel maggio del 1403 un fulmine abbatté la cima della torre e solo nel 1448 iniziarono i lavori di restauro e di innalzamento, che durarono sino al 1464. Inizialmente la torre aveva un'altezza minore rispetto a quella odierna, e la differente età di costruzione è visibile ancora grazie ai differenti materiali utilizzati: prima mattoni e tufo, poi solamente mattoni, ed infine il marmo. Il grande orologio venne aggiunto, invece, solo nel 1779. Su di essa furono poste due campane, di cui la più piccola, detta Marangona, serviva per segnalare gli incendi e le ore della giornata, mentre la più grande, detta Rengo, per radunare il consiglio comunale e per chiamare alle armi i cittadini. Il nome Rengo deriva da arengo, il luogo in cui, durante il Medioevo, si svolgevano le assemblee, mentre Marangona deriva da marangon, che nel dialetto veronese significa falegname. La Torre detiene il primato di edificio più alto della città di Verona, seguita dal bianco campanile del duomo alto m.74,9 tra gli edifici civili segue "Grattacielo", alto 52 metri. La torre è oggi visitabile, e si può raggiungere la cima attraverso le scale o un ascensore, godendo così della vista panoramica della città. da wikipedia
photo.tags: gengish verona italia italy veneto città travelling travel vacancy holiday art arte fotografia torre lamberti piazza erbe tower place square borgo medioevo middleages italiamedievale
photo.title: Verona: Torrei dei Lamberti a Piazza dei Signori

photo.description: Off Piazza delle Erbe is Piazza dei Signori. Surrounded by many interesting historical buildings. Statues on buildings and in the square. This is the statue / monument of Dante Alighieri. This statue was erected here because Dante stayed here for a period. 1865 was the sixth centennial of the birth of Dante and Italy was about to solemnly commemorate the recurrence. As an initiative of the Academy of Agriculture and the Society of Fine Arts, to which the City Council adhered, it was decided to erect a statue of Dante in Piazza dei Signori, where the Scala Palace that had hosted the “Ghibellin fuggiasco”. On 6th October 1863 a call for tender was emanated for the design of the statue. The only conditions were that the second quality Carrara marble be suitable for a height of three meters, supported by a pedestal and that the figure, which would turn its back to via delle Fogge, have its head turned slightly towards the left, or namely towards Scala Palace of the Courts. It was then stated that the Poet must have been turned towards free Italy. The winner of the tender was a young, entirely unknown artist, Ugo Zannoni. The statue was uncovered on 14 May 1865, in the early morning. Wikimapia - Dante Alighieri The statue of Dante standing in the centre of the square is the work of Ugo Zannoni, completed in 1865. Majority of this information came from the book "Verona: History and Masterpieces - English Edition".
photo.tags: piazzadeisignori verona piazzadelleerbe italy veneto northernitaly worldheritagesite unesco unescoworldheritagesite statue monument dantealighieri ugozannoni
photo.title: Statue of Dante Alighieri, Piazza dei Signori, Verona

photo.description: Off Piazza delle Erbe is Piazza dei Signori. Surrounded by many interesting historical buildings. This is the Palazzo degli Scaligeri. The original building dates to the 12th century, but through the years it has been extensively altered. The facade itself, with its battlements in the style prevalent during the Ghibelline period, is the result of fairly recent restoration work. Italian flag on the Palazzo. It is hard to wait for the flag to flag into a decent shot, sometimes the wind doesn't react as you want it to when pointing your camera at the flag. Majority of this information came from the book "Verona: History and Masterpieces - English Edition".
photo.tags: piazzadeisignori verona piazzadelleerbe italy veneto northernitaly worldheritagesite unesco unescoworldheritagesite palazzodegliscaligeri battlements ghibellineperiod alterations restoration flag italianflag
photo.title: Palazzo degli Scaligeri, Piazza dei Signori, Verona - Italian flag

photo.description: Off Piazza delle Erbe is Piazza dei Signori. Surrounded by many interesting historical buildings. This is the Logia del Consiglio. also named after "Fra Giocondo". It was built between 1476 and 1493. The attribution of the building to the Veronese architect Fra Giocondo is uncertain. This is the finest Renaissance building in Verona, where an almost Tuscan simplicity of lines blends with subtle decorative work and a warmth of colour reminiscent of Venetian architecture. Statues of Catullus, Pliny, Marcus, Vitruvius and Cornelius Nepos by Alberto da Milano crown the building. Majority of this information came from the book "Verona: History and Masterpieces - English Edition".

photo.description: Off Piazza delle Erbe is Piazza dei Signori. Surrounded by many interesting historical buildings. Statues on buildings and in the square. Entering from Piazza delle Erbe is the Palazzo del Comune. The Romanesque facade of this tall building received considerable additions during the Renaissance period. It has distinctive alternating bands of brick and stonework which can be considered the leitmotiv of the city as a whole. This arch contains the statue of Enrico Noris. Majority of this information came from the book "Verona: History and Masterpieces - English Edition".

photo.title: Palazzo del Comune, Piazza dei Signori, Verona - arch containing the statue of Enrico Noris

photo.description: L'alta Torre dei Lamberti (o Torre del Comune), eretta la prima volta nel 1172. La Torre, la cui cima fu abbattuta da un fulmine nel 1403, è stata restaurata tra il 1448 ed il 1463-1464

photo.description: Off Piazza delle Erbe is Piazza dei Signori. Surrounded by many interesting historical buildings. The walkway between the two squares, including bridges between buildings. Entering from Piazza delle Erbe is the Palazzo del Comune. The Romanesque facade of this tall building received considerable additions during the Renaissance period. It has distinctive alternating bands of brick and stonework which can be considered the leitmotiv of the city as a whole. From the Piazza delle Erbe (going towards the Piazza dei Signori) is the Arco della Costa. A whole rib is hanging below it. Between Piazza Erbe and Piazza dei Signori is that for centuries has been called Arco della Costa, built in about 1470. Hanging under the arch, a curved rib, very similar to the Almenno Bergamasco. For some of the remains of a whale, for others the remains of an ancient dragon. Wikimapia - Arco della Costa Majority of this information came from the book "Verona: History and Masterpieces - English Edition".
photo.tags: piazzadeisignori verona piazzadelleerbe italy veneto northernitaly worldheritagesite unesco unescoworldheritagesite bridge palazzodelcomune romanesquefacade renaissanceperiod distinctivealternatingbandsofbrickandstonework leitmotiv arcodellacosta wholerib almennobergamasco
photo.title: Palazzo del Comune, Piazza dei Signori, Verona - Arco della Costa - whole rib

The Romanesque facade of this tall building received considerable additions during the Renaissance period. It has distinctive alternating bands of brick and stonework which can be considered the leitmotiv of the city as a whole. photo.description: In piazza dei signori that is also known as piazza Dante. Verona is a city in Veneto, northern Italy, home to approx. 265,000 inhabitants and one of the seven provincial capitals of the region. It is the second most populated municipality of the region and the third of North-East Italy. The metro area of Verona has an area of 1.426 km2 (0.55 sq mi) and has a population of 714,274 inhabitants.[1] It is one of the main tourist destinations in northern Italy, thanks to its artistic heritage, several annual fairs, shows, and operas, such as the lyrical season in the Arena, the ancient amphitheatre built by the Romans. The city has been awarded world heritage site status by UNESCO because of its urban structure and architecture. - wiki

photo.description: Off Piazza delle Erbe is Piazza dei Signori. Surrounded by many interesting historical buildings. This is the Palazzo del Capitano in Piazza dei Signori. It has a 16th century facade, and a splendid entrance by Sanmicheli of the same century. Majority of this information came from the book "Verona: History and Masterpieces - English Edition". Sign of the Palazzo del Capitano (I may have read it at first as Piazza not Palazzo, as there was another square through here).

photo.description: Off Piazza delle Erbe is Piazza dei Signori. Surrounded by many interesting historical buildings. This is the Palazzo degli Scaligeri. The original building dates to the 12th century, but through the years it has been extensively altered. The facade itself, with its battlements in the style prevalent during the Ghibelline period, is the result of fairly recent restoration work. Italian flag on the Palazzo. It is hard to wait for the flag to flag into a decent shot, sometimes the wind doesn't react as you want it to when pointing your camera at the flag. Majority of this information came from the book "Verona: History and Masterpieces - English Edition".

photo.description: Off Piazza delle Erbe is Piazza dei Signori. Surrounded by many interesting historical buildings. Entering from Piazza delle Erbe is the Palazzo del Comune. The Romanesque facade of this tall building received considerable additions during the Renaissance period. It has distinctive alternating bands of brick and stonework which can be considered the leitmotiv of the city as a whole. Majority of this information came from the book "Verona: History and Masterpieces - English Edition".
photo.tags: piazzadeisignori verona piazzadelleerbe italy veneto northernitaly worldheritagesite unesco unescoworldheritagesite palazzodelcomune romanesquefacade renaissanceperiod distinctivealternatingbandsofbrickandstonework leitmotiv
photo.title: Palazzo del Comune, Piazza dei Signori, Verona

photo.description: Off Piazza delle Erbe is Piazza dei Signori. Surrounded by many interesting historical buildings. Entering from Piazza delle Erbe is the Palazzo del Comune. The Romanesque facade of this tall building received considerable additions during the Renaissance period. It has distinctive alternating bands of brick and stonework which can be considered the leitmotiv of the city as a whole. From the Piazza dei Signori is the Torre dei Lamberti. It rises 274 feet above the square (both Signori and Erbe). It was begun in 1172 and completed in 1464 which the construction of the octagonal belfry which still houses two ancient bells, the Rengo and the Marangona. Majority of this information came from the book "Verona: History and Masterpieces - English Edition".
photo.tags: piazzadeisignori verona piazzadelleerbe italy veneto northernitaly worldheritagesite unesco unescoworldheritagesite palazzodelcomune romanesquefacade renaissanceperiod distinctivealternatingbandsofbrickandstonework leitmotiv torredeilamberti octagonalbelfry twoancientbells rengo marangona
photo.title: Palazzo del Comune, Piazza dei Signori, Verona - Torre dei Lamberti

photo.description: This area is just outside the Piazza dei Signori. Opposite the tombs were these flags on the side of the Palazzo degli Scaligeri. Includes the EU and Italian flag and two others.

photo.description: Off Piazza delle Erbe is Piazza dei Signori. Surrounded by many interesting historical buildings. This building is The Domus Nova. It has an 18th century facade. With it's grand central arch. The building houses the Caffe Dante, which is unique in that it still maintains it's 19th century interior decoration. Majority of this information came from the book "Verona: History and Masterpieces - English Edition".

photo.title: The Domus Nova, Piazza dei Signori, Verona

photo.description: This area is accessed via the Piazza dei Signori in Verona. It is the courtyard of the Palazzo del Capitano. In here you would find the Porta Bombardiera (dating from 1687).

photo.description: This area is accessed via the Piazza dei Signori in Verona. It is the courtyard of the Palazzo del Capitano. In here you would find the Porta Bombardiera (dating from 1687). The Porta Bombardiera is in the bottom left of this image.

photo.description: Took these shots for those busts on the wall. We were in the square - Piazza Indipendenza. Quite near Romeo's House. The Torre dei Lamberti as seen from Piazza Indipendenza. It rises 274 feet above the square (both Signori and Erbe). It was begun in 1172 and completed in 1464 which the construction of the octagonal belfry which still houses two ancient bells, the Rengo and the Marangona. Majority of this information came from the book "Verona: History and Masterpieces - English Edition".
photo.tags: piazzaindipendenza verona palazzodelcapitano italy veneto northernitaly worldheritagesite unesco unescoworldheritagesite torredeilamberti octagonalbelfry twoancientbells rengo marangona
photo.title: The back of the Palazzo del Capitano from Piazza Indipendenza, Verona - the Torre dei Lamberti

photo.description: This area is just outside the Piazza dei Signori. Also near the tombs was this side street. Probably the Vicolo Cavalletto.

photo.title: Side street near the tombs in Verona - Vicolo Cavalletto

photo.description: Off Piazza delle Erbe is Piazza dei Signori. Surrounded by many interesting historical buildings. The walkway between the two squares, including bridges between buildings. Entering from Piazza delle Erbe is the Palazzo del Comune. The Romanesque facade of this tall building received considerable additions during the Renaissance period. It has distinctive alternating bands of brick and stonework which can be considered the leitmotiv of the city as a whole. From the Piazza delle Erbe (going towards the Piazza dei Signori) is the Arco della Costa. A whole rib is hanging below it. Between Piazza Erbe and Piazza dei Signori is that for centuries has been called Arco della Costa, built in about 1470. Hanging under the arch, a curved rib, very similar to the Almenno Bergamasco. For some of the remains of a whale, for others the remains of an ancient dragon. Wikimapia - Arco della Costa Majority of this information came from the book "Verona: History and Masterpieces - English Edition". Notice the forbidden sign, things you are not supposed to do in Verona. (zoom in to read what it says - press All Sizes)
photo.tags: piazzadeisignori verona piazzadelleerbe italy veneto northernitaly worldheritagesite unesco unescoworldheritagesite bridge palazzodelcomune romanesquefacade renaissanceperiod distinctivealternatingbandsofbrickandstonework leitmotiv arcodellacosta wholerib almennobergamasco sign vietatoforbidden
photo.title: Palazzo del Comune, Piazza dei Signori, Verona - Arco della Costa - whole rib

photo.description: Off Piazza delle Erbe is Piazza dei Signori. Surrounded by many interesting historical buildings. The walkway between the two squares, including bridges between buildings. Entering from Piazza delle Erbe is the Palazzo del Comune. The Romanesque facade of this tall building received considerable additions during the Renaissance period. It has distinctive alternating bands of brick and stonework which can be considered the leitmotiv of the city as a whole. The back of the arch with the statue of Enrico Noris. Majority of this information came from the book "Verona: History and Masterpieces - English Edition".

photo.description: My favourite square seen from the Lamberti Tower. Verona - Italy
photo.tags: italy verona
photo.title: Piazza dei Signori

photo.description: This area is just outside the Piazza dei Signori. This is the Scala Tombs outside the Santa Maria Antica church. It is the burial place of members of the Scala family, such as Cangrande I della Scala, who died in 1329. The church was founded in teh 7th century. It is a splendid example of Romanesque architecture in Verona. The tomb closest to the church entrance is the tomb of Mastino II. The one furthest away is the tomb of Cansignorio by Bonino da Campione and Gaspare Broaspini.
photo.tags: piazzadeisignori verona piazzadelleerbe italy veneto northernitaly worldheritagesite unesco unescoworldheritagesite scalatombs santamariaantica santamariaanticachurch cangrandeidellascala romanesquearchitecture gothiccanopy mastinoii casginorio boninodacampione gasparebroaspini
photo.title: Santa Maria Antica and Scala Tombs, Verona
